description: Temporary open storage (Use Class B8) use for a temporary period of three years
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing number(s): Location Plan 10700 Rev 2.

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | The development hereby permitted is granted for a limited period only expiring on 30/09/2025. On or before this date, the development carried out in pursuance of this permission shall be removed from the site and the land restored to its former condition.

Reason: To ensure that the use is temporary in nature in accordance with the permission given. | Any external artificial lighting at the development shall not exceed lux levels of vertical illumination at neighbouring premises that are recommended by the Institution of Lighting Professionals in the 'Guidance Notes for The Reduction of Light Pollution 2011'. Lighting should be minimized and glare and sky glow should be prevented by correctly using, locating, aiming and shielding luminaires, in accordance with the Guidance Notes.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of occupiers of nearby properties in accordance with policy 1.1 (j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), and policy D6 of the London Plan (2021). | (A) Prior to any installation of plant on the site, details shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, of the external sound level emitted from any plant/machinery/ equipment used at the site in connection with storage operations, vehicle movements and scrap metal recycling, together with mitigation measures, as appropriate. The measures shall ensure that the external sound level LAeq emitted from the use/operation of plant/ machinery/equipment will be lower than the existing background sound level LA90 by at least 10 dBA at the most noise sensitive receiver location at the development site and neighbouring premises, including offices. The assessment shall be made in accordance with BS4142:2014 and BS8233:2014, with all machinery/ equipment in any one location operating together at maximum capacity. Details of any noise mitigation measures shall be submitted for approval.

(B) If any plant is installed on the site, a post installation sound assessment shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval in writing. The assessment shall be carried out to confirm compliance with the noise criteria set out in Part A of this condition and shall include additional steps to mitigate noise as necessary.

Approved details shall be implemented prior to use of any plant/ machinery/ equipment and thereafter be permanently retained.  Part A of this condition shall be retained throughout the operational phase of the development.

Reason:   To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise, fumes, steam or smells, in accordance with policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies and policy D14 of the London Plan (2021), the National Planning Policy Framework (2021) and Interim guidance SPG 10 'Noise and Vibration'. | Provision for cycle storage for 11 long-stay cycle spaces and 6 short-stay cycle spaces and in accordance with London Plan (2021) standards shall be provided prior to occupation and be continuously available and retained for the life of the development hereby approved.

Reason: To promote sustainable patterns of transport, in accordance with Section 9 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2021) and policy T5 of the London Plan (2021). | Prior to the first occupation of the development hereby approved, one disabled parking space shall be provided to accord with London Plan (2021) standards and this infrastructure together with the associated access and internal carriageway shall be kept continuously available for the life of the development hereby approved.

Reason: To comply with Policies D5 and T6 of the London Plan (2021). | No more than nine car parking spaces shall be provided on the site and these shall be marked out prior to the first occupation or use of the development hereby approved.

Reason: To promote sustainable patterns of transport, in accordance with Section 9 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2021) and policies T4 and T6 of the London Plan (2021). | No open storage or processing of waste materials (excluding storage of scrap metal) shall be carried out on the site.

Reason: In the interests of the amenity of occupiers of nearby properties in accordance with policy 1.1 (j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013).
